file_content.text: Agent. I hope this recorded message finds you well. This is Aristocra Saganu of the Chiss Expansionary Defense Force.
I never got the chance to see you off Hoth. Understandable--things were... hectic.
But you represent the future of the Chiss Ascendancy, and that will not go unrecognized.
I pronounce you merit adoptive of House Miurani. My house.
In another age, I would've kept you by my side, spent our days and nights together. Now this is my only gift.
Fight well, my Red Flame. Saganu out.
It is the least I can do to honor you.
Nonetheless, you proved a worthy ally. You are a woman not soon forgotten.
Nonetheless, you proved a worthy ally, and one deserving of the Ascendancy's trust.
A token of our appreciation has been delivered to Imperial Intelligence. I hope they will pass it on to you.
Fight well, my friend. Saganu out.
And lastly... give my regards to Ensign Temple. Doubtless she serves you as well as she served us.
It's time to begin the operation.
This isn't a one-squad operation. The Defense Force will join you for the assault.
I'll take any help you can give.
Glad to have you.
I told you before: My priority is the Starbreeze, not Admiral Davos or the rest of his treasure.
All I want is the Starbreeze.
My priority is a Republic shuttle--part of the admiral's hoard. Everything else is secondary.
All I want is the Starbreeze.
While the Chiss Ascendancy believes Admiral Davos is a threat, our goals are not incompatible.
This is an Imperial Intelligence operation. Your assistance is not required.
That's unacceptable.
I spent a lot of time convincing them otherwise.
Even if she hadn't, Admiral Davos is too much of a threat. The Chiss Ascendancy has an interest, here.
I suggest a two-pronged approach. You slip past the pirates on the superdreadnaught and deactivate the blast doors.
That'll let my team in. We can rendezvous at the launch bay; we'll be your backup.
Skirmish tactics, blaster rifles and electrostaves only--we don't want to damage the hoard.
Get your people ready.
Understood, sir. We'll stay on our toes.
I think you like keeping an eye on me.
[Flirt] Looking forward to it.
If you catch them making out in the middle of a fight, just shoot them. They're dead weight.
Do not suggest treason again.
Agent, please! You make me look unprofessional.
Together against a thousand pirates and Imperial traitors. It'll be memorable.
Looking forward to it.
Something to tell your grandchildren, once it's declassified.
And if I refuse... I don't get the launch bay coordinates. Am I right?
You're leaving me no choice?
You make it sound like blackmail. Besides, maybe you'll learn to like us.
Dismissed, all of you. It's time to move.
Good luck, sir. I'll see you at the dreadnaught.
One last thing: You've done us proud--the Ascendancy needs more like you in the Empire.
But more than that, you embody the Red Flame--our courage, our cunning and our discipline. You are a remarkable woman.
I'm remarkable, but you're supposed to act professional. Get it together, Aristocra.
You're out of line.
One last thing: I've made it clear that I admire your skill... but more than that, you embody the Red Flame--the discipline, cunning and courage all Chiss aspire to.
I never thought to see it in a woman from another world.
Thank you, sir.
I'm only an aristocra. You are a soldier.
Isn't there anything else you want to say? Before I risk my life?
[Flirt] Is that all?
There's nothing more I want to say.
It's time. Admiral Davos is on the move... and my forces are waiting.
If all goes well, perhaps we'll meet again.
I'll only say this once. I'm not interested in an alien's "attentions."
You blue-skinned creep....
I see. I apologize for the miscommunication.
My forces will be waiting for you to open the dreadnaught doors. Good hunting.
You've done us proud. We'll need more like you in the Empire if the Ascendancy is ever to seize its rightful place.
Good luck.
Sir!
I suggest we begin. Admiral Davos is already on the move.
I'll see you at the dreadnaught. Either way, this'll all be over soon.
We'd be buried alive by the third marker. Bring up the northern passage, let me see....
She's here, sir.
He's here, sir.
I am aware of that. Resume planning.
Glad to see you, agent. Thanks to your surveillance, we have a lock on Admiral Davos's destination.
You've done well, agent. Thanks to your surveillance, we have a lock on Admiral Davos's destination.
Agent. Thanks to your surveillance, we have a lock on Admiral Davos's destination.
He and his men are being escorted to a crashed Republic superdreadnaught in the heart of the starship graveyard. His hoard is there.
I need to get inside. What are our options?
Brief me.
There a reason you say that like it's a death sentence?
Why do you look grim?
Have some faith in me, Aristocra. I won't disappoint you.
[Flirt] Don't sound so grim....
I promise, you are not in question.
By the time he arrives, all that's left will be ice.
Not if I get it first.
If only it were that simple.
The hoard is sealed in the tertiary launch bay, protected by an army of White Maw pirates.
Sorry I'm late. Did I miss the bad news?
There's no other kind.
Lovely. Go on.
Ensign Temple will contact you from the field. Good luck.
See if you can contact our men in grid alpha two. I have a feeling we'll need them.
Sir.
Agent--I thought you'd be out on the ice plains. What can I do for you?
I wanted to ask about Csilla. It's been a long time since I was home.
How's our homeworld?
Csilla is... as it always is. Beautiful and frigid. Walking the iceways, one almost forgets the Ruling Family disputes, the House Paiiri collapse....
Still, it belongs to us--not one Imperial starship has touched Csillan ground.
Our alliance with the Empire serves a purpose. But we must always protect Csilla from foreign influence.
Stay proud and independent.
That's not an Imperial Intelligence officer speaking. That's a member of the Chiss Secret Police.
I'm not familiar with the Chiss Ascendancy. I'd appreciate your insight.
Tell me about the Chiss.
Where to start? Our forces stretch across a dozen systems, only a few ever seen by outsiders.
Since the alliance with the Empire, we've prospered. Our borders and our resources are secure. It seems... worth the price.
You sound like you have doubts.
You disapprove of the Empire?
I admire the Empire, as does my house. Our societies have much to learn from one another.
Yet... it would be easy for the Ascendancy to fall under the Empire's shadow. To lose what makes us Chiss.
The Chiss don't seem welcoming of outsiders.
I'm noticing a lot of secrecy...
The Empire believes in the glory of the individual--one Sith, one Emperor, transforming the galaxy. The Chiss have no such aspirations.
We have much to learn from one another. But when you have pacified the galaxy, we will return to isolation.
Give it time. Sith will run the Ascendancy within thirty years.
It will all be Imperial soon.
Not if I can help it. I believe in the alliance--but not at the cost of our pride.
You can't get many new faces down here. I thought you'd enjoy some company.
[Flirt] Let's chat....
Company, then--for what little time we have. It has been a while since I met a stranger face-to-face.
A little while ago, you didn't think much of us, you know. Now you seem much more personable.
I keep my professional and personal lives separate. It's just a very thin line.
That was business.
It's quite an admirable trick.
I didn't know what to expect from you when I saw your file. It certainly didn't say you were so personable.
I was trained to be personable--as well as deadly.
Charm is part of the job.
I was trained to lead. I expect our methods differ a great deal.
Aristocra. Are you trying to compliment me?
You're very kind.
So much as protocol allows. Still, I look forward to seeing you work.
Maybe now that we're friends, you can show me around Zero Station? There must be more than this....
Tell me some secrets?
Quite a bit--all off-limits, however.
Sir. Transmission from Ensign Starsh.
We'll have to continue later... and thank you. I don't often enjoy such conversation.
I was wondering--how did a human end up in your Defense Force?
What's Ensign Temple's story?
I appreciate your curiosity, but Defense Force personnel records are confidential.
That said... Raina Temple is an exceptional officer. I'm grateful she transferred here.
So she did start out in the Empire?
Transferred...?
She'll decide what to tell you. Not me.
I assume you've noticed her other assets?
She's cute, too.
She's human. I notice that.
Now, we both have work to do. I wish you luck in your hunt.
Whatever you may think, you're in no position to hide information.
Don't keep secrets from me.
I'll keep that in mind. But for the moment, we have work to do.
Let's be clear: This base is a violation of Imperial sovereignty. Its existence will not be tolerated.
The Empire will hear of this.
Declare what you like. Our presence here is legal, based on all existing treaties. The fact that you never noticed us is immaterial.
Now I suggest you leave before I think better of assisting you.
All right. Goodbye.
Then I'll wish you luck.
It was a warning, Aristocra. Not a threat.
This was for your own good.
Your rank doesn't make you safe. Remember that.
I'm a dangerous enemy.
I represent the will of Darth Jadus. Nothing can protect you from that.
I'm a dangerous enemy.
I'll remember.
Yes? How can I help you?
